Comments_List: Definitely walked away with increased ability to understand slurred, fast-paced, colloquial french.
Strengthened my communication (oral production), writing, and analytical French skills.

Strength: loved the organized class trips
Weakness: would have been ok spending less time in class or attending class less frequently per week

Strengths: organized, excellent content (short stories written by non-French francophone authors was probably my favorite aspect of the course)
Weaknesses: grammar was less of a focus (can be seen as either a good or bad thing), workload was intense which made it difficult to go out and explore Paris at times
Yes; you get to see French culture up close and personal. Being in France really aids in the progression of learning French.
Definitely! Even though the workload of this course was frustratingly intense at times, I genuinely believe my French skills immensely improved. And I had such a great experience in Paris!
